201.comments: This course is restricted to students in the Biomechanics and Biomaterials stream in Biomedical Engineering. Students not part of this stream will be dropped without notification. Contact undergrad@bme.ubc.ca with any questions.

T2A.comments: This course is restricted to students in the Biomechanics  and  Biomaterials stream in Biomedical Engineering. Students not part of this stream will be dropped without notification. Contact undergrad@bme.ubc.ca with any questions.^ every second week starting with week following start week

description: Principles and common elements of sports-, orthopaedic-, injury- and cellular length-biomechanics. Improving sports performance and preventing overuse injuries through sports biomechanics, designing orthopaedic implants through orthopaedic biomechanics, preventing injuries through injury biomechanics and identifying and filtering cancerous blood cells through cellular biomechanics. Students who have received credit for MECH 435 cannot also receive credit for BMEG 230 or BMEG 330.
